DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the role of a Patient Navigator in the process of patient screening for a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Persons who can be trained to guide and support those requiring assistance obtaining medical care. Such persons are sensitive to socio-economic factors within the community and provide a variety of services. Their primary responsibilities are to assist patients that have an abnormal examination or a positive finding to navigate through the health care system._A systematic examination or assessment._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

PermissibleValues.value: Navigator referred patient to the research team
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Patient Navigator referred patient to research team

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Patient Navigator referred patient to research team
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Persons who can be trained to guide and support those requiring assistance obtaining medical care. Such persons are sensitive to socio-economic factors within the community and provide a variety of services. Their primary responsibilities are to assist patients that have an abnormal examination or a positive finding to navigate through the health care system.: Sending a patient from one practitioner to another for health care services.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes. Interventions include but are not restricted to drugs, cells and other biological products, surgical procedures, radiologic procedures, devices, behavioral treatments, process-of-care changes, and preventive care.: Two or more people working together.: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: Persons who are trained to guide and support those requiring assistance obtaining medical care. Such persons are sensitive to socio-economic factors within the community and provide a variety of services. Their primary responsibilities are to assist patients that have an abnormal examination or a positive finding to navigate through the health care system.
Sending a patient from one practitioner to another for health care services.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
Two or more people working together.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Persons who can be trained to guide and support those requiring assistance obtaining medical care. Such persons are sensitive to socio-economic factors within the community and provide a variety of services. Their primary responsibilities are to assist patients that have an abnormal examination or a positive finding to navigate through the health care system.: A systematic examination or assessment.: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.
